From what I've seen of JUnit4, the main extension mechanism is to use
the R=
unWith annotation, and this replaces the "normal" use of
TestClassRunner wi=
th the specified runner.

Unfortunately, this means that all the work done =
by TestClassRunner is
then wasted. As a very concrete example of this probl=
em, I can see great
benefits in using parameterised tests (more on that in =
another mail) but
I could easily want to use them in conjunction with
@Befo=
reClass/@AfterClass (whether another "level" of setup/teardown,
taking plac=
e after all the tests for a particular parameter set would be
good or not i=
s an open question in my mind). Additionally, I can see
there potentially b=
eing other extensions which I'd want to use in
conjunction with each other.=


I can't see a neat way round this without being prescriptive about the
ki=
nds of extensions which are available (at which point you could chain
certa=
in types together - introspectors which found or removed possible
tests, fo=
r example). I thought I'd raise it as a concern though. (I
admit I'm less c=
oncerned than I was before I saw that @Before, @After,
expected exceptions =
and timed tests are all handled by TestMethodRunner
rather than TestClassRu=
nner.)

Any thoughts?
